data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you take 9 steps left, you are already facing forward. Take 10 steps left and that is the direction they are facing now. In the first move to the left, you take three steps left and that is the direction their feet are. In the second move to the left, you take 1 step left and that is the direction the front of their legs are. In the third move to the right, you take 6 steps left and that is the direction their torso is. When you take 3 steps left, they are facing forward. In the fourth move to the right, they are facing backward. When you take 6 steps left, they are facing outward. When you take 3 steps forward, they are facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you need to always start with the opposite direction. Taking 8 steps in reverse directions does not equal 10 steps forward. Taking 7 steps backward does not reduce to 10 steps forward which is the same as 10 steps forward. Taking a step backward is referred to as stepping back once. If your moving in the right direction, when you go backward, the steps are 4 steps forward, 4 steps backward and 1 step left. If your moving in the left direction, when you go to the left side, the steps are 10 steps right, 4 steps forward and 4 steps left. Working in the right direction implies doing this way. So, the answer is No.
